page.title: 18MILTON OF BALGONIE GALA DAY.
page.content: One of our customs is the June Gala Day.In{fancy dresses}and led by a piper,we{parade}through Milton to the park.We line up on a stage and our costumes are judged by a celebrity. Seats line the racing lanes and everyone watches the{races.}I like the wheelbarrow race where Sandra runs on her hands while I hold her feet. Different{competitions}are next.Last year I enjoyed the knobbly knees one where everyone showed their knees.I loved jumping on the huge,plastic,{air {filled castle}and I won a toy for knocking down cans with a ball,at the {side stalls. Food and drink}are in a tent and people get hot dogs (sausges in rolls),crisps,juice, cakes and tubs of jelly.At the end,everyone watches {entertainments}like Highland Dancers or Majorettes.The{Gala Day Dance}is attended by adults,in the evening.
